title: Scaling the GCR Solver Using a High-Level Stencil Framework on Multi- and Many-Core Architectures
Elliptic Solver Performance Evaluation on Modern Hardware Architectures
Distributed power management and control system for sustainable computing environments

event.name: 2010 International Conference on Green Computing (Green Comp)

items.abstract: <jats:p>The recent advent of novel multi- and many-core architectures forces application programmers to deal with hardware-specific implementation details and to be familiar with software optimisation techniques to benefit from new high-performance computing machines. Extra care must be taken for communication-intensive algorithms, which may be a bottleneck for forthcoming era of exascale computing. This paper aims to present a high-level stencil framework implemented for the EULerian or LAGrangian model (EULAG) that efficiently utilises multi- and many-cores architectures. Only an efficient usage of both many-core processors (CPUs) and graphics processing units (GPUs) with the flexible data decomposition method can lead to the maximum performance that scales the communication-intensive Generalized Conjugate Residual (GCR) elliptic solver with preconditioner.</jats:p>
title: Methods to Load Balance a GCR Pressure Solver Using a Stencil Framework on Multi- and Many-Core Architectures
